sn10.8:1.11.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa nagaramhā nikkhamantassa āloko antaradhāyi, andhakāro pāturahosi, bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso udapādi, tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi.
sn10.8:1.11.en: But as he was leaving the city, light vanished and darkness appeared to him. He felt fear, terror, and goosebumps, and wanted to turn back.

sn10.8:4.1.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa andhakāro antaradhāyi, āloko pāturahosi, yaṁ ahosi bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso, so paṭippassambhi.
sn10.8:4.1.en: Then darkness vanished and light appeared to Anāthapiṇḍika. His fear, terror, and goosebumps settled down.

sn10.8:4.2.pli: Dutiyampi kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa āloko antaradhāyi, andhakāro pāturahosi, bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso udapādi, tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi.
sn10.8:4.2.en: But for a second time, light vanished and darkness appeared to him. …

sn10.8:7.1.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa andhakāro antaradhāyi, āloko pāturahosi, yaṁ ahosi bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso, so paṭippassambhi.
sn10.8:7.1.en: Then darkness vanished and light appeared to Anāthapiṇḍika. His fear, terror, and goosebumps settled down.

sn10.8:7.2.pli: Tatiyampi kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa āloko antaradhāyi, andhakāro pāturahosi, bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso udapādi, tatova puna nivattitukāmo ahosi.
sn10.8:7.2.en: But for a third time, light vanished and darkness appeared to him. …

sn10.8:10.1.pli: Atha kho anāthapiṇḍikassa gahapatissa andhakāro antaradhāyi, āloko pāturahosi, yaṁ ahosi bhayaṁ chambhitattaṁ lomahaṁso, so paṭippassambhi.
sn10.8:10.1.en: Then darkness vanished and light appeared to Anāthapiṇḍika. His fear, terror, and goosebumps settled down.

sn3.21:6.1.en: And how is a person light and bound for darkness?

sn3.21:7.3.pli: Evaṁ kho, mahārāja, puggalo jotitamaparāyano hoti.
sn3.21:7.3.en: That’s how a person is light and bound for darkness.

sn3.21:15.6.en: from darkness they’re bound for light.

sn3.21:18.6.en: from light they’re bound for darkness.

an4.85:1.5.en: the light bound for darkness, and

an4.85:4.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, puggalo joti hoti tamaparāyaṇo?
an4.85:4.1.en: And how is a person light and bound for darkness?

an4.85:4.6.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, puggalo joti hoti tamaparāyaṇo.
an4.85:4.6.en: That’s how a person is light and bound for darkness.

an3.59:4.4.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
an3.59:4.4.en: Ignorance is destroyed and knowledge has arisen; darkness is destroyed and light has arisen, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

an3.59:5.4.pli: avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.

mn85:34-37.8.pli: vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
mn85:34-37.8.en: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

mn85:39.1.pli: ayaṁ kho me, rājakumāra, rattiyā majjhime yāme dutiyā vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
mn85:39.1.en: This was the second knowledge, which I achieved in the middle watch of the night. Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

mn85:42.2.pli: vijjā adhigatā, avijjā vihatā, vijjā uppannā; tamo vihato, āloko uppanno—yathā taṁ appamattassa ātāpino pahitattassa viharato.
mn85:42.2.en: Ignorance was destroyed and knowledge arose; darkness was destroyed and light arose, as happens for a meditator who is diligent, keen, and resolute.

an6.62:10.13.pli: “Seyyathāpi vā pana, ānanda, sāyanhasamayaṁ sūriye ogacchante, jāneyyāsi tvaṁ, ānanda, āloko antaradhāyissati andhakāro pātubhavissatī”ti?
an6.62:10.13.en: “Or suppose it was the late afternoon and the sun was going down. Wouldn’t you know that the light was about to vanish and darkness appear?”

an6.62:10.15.pli: “Seyyathāpi vā, panānanda, abhido addharattaṁ bhattakālasamaye, jāneyyāsi tvaṁ, ānanda, āloko antarahito andhakāro pātubhūto”ti?
an6.62:10.15.en: “Or suppose that it’s nearly time for the midnight meal. Wouldn’t you know that the light had vanished and the darkness appeared?”

sn14.11:3.1.pli: “Yāyaṁ, bhikkhu, ābhādhātu—ayaṁ dhātu andhakāraṁ paṭicca paññāyati.
sn14.11:3.1.en: “Mendicant, the element of light appears due to the element of darkness.

sn2.10:5.1.en: He shines a light in the darkness,

dn21:1.9.1.pli: Tena kho pana samayena indasālaguhā visamā santī samā samapādi, sambādhā santī urundā samapādi, andhakāro guhāyaṁ antaradhāyi, āloko udapādi yathā taṁ devānaṁ devānubhāvena.
dn21:1.9.1.en: And at that time the uneven places were evened out, the cramped places were opened up, the darkness vanished and light appeared, as happens through the glory of the gods.

dn33:1.11.216.pli: tamo tamaparāyano, tamo jotiparāyano, joti tamaparāyano, joti jotiparāyano. #49
dn33:1.11.216.en: the dark bound for darkness, the dark bound for light, the light bound for darkness, and the light bound for light.
